intro: Hieracium lepthanthelum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
